嚳字的基本解释

嚳
kù
见“喾”。

嚳字的汉语字典释义

[①]［kù］
［《廣韻》苦沃切，入沃，溪。］
亦作“俈1”。“喾1”的繁体字。
(1)至极。
(2)传说中的五帝之一。黄帝子玄嚣后裔。居亳，号高辛氏。卜辞中商人以帝喾为高祖。
(3)犬名。

嚳字的康熙字典解释

【丑集上】【口字部】　嚳； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页214第04
【唐韻】苦沃切【集韻】【韻會】枯沃切，?音酷。【說文】急告之甚也。　又【史記·五帝紀】帝嚳高辛者，黃帝之曾孫也。【集韻】亦作俈。【史記·三代世表】帝俈，黃帝曾孫。

嚳字的源字形

喾
Basic explanation of words
喾
kù

喾
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［kù］
["Guangyun" bitter and fertile cutting, into the fertile, creek. ]
Also known as "F1". Traditional characters for "喾1".
(1) Extremely.
(2) One of the five emperors in the legend. Descendant of Huangdizi Xuanxiao. Living in Bo, the number is Gaoxin's. In the oracle, the merchant regards the emperor as the great ancestor.
(3) The name of the dog.
喾
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chou Ji 1] [Words Department] 　喾; Kangxi strokes: 20; Page number: page 214 04
[Tang Yun] bitter wow cut [Jiyun] [rhyme meeting] wow cut, cool sound. [Said the text] What's the urgent need to tell.　[Historical Records · Five Emperors] The emperor is a Gaoxin, and the great-grandson of the Yellow Emperor. [Ji Yun] also used as a qi. 【Historical Records · Three Generations Table】Emperor Li, great-grandson of Huangdi.
